Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ArrayMethods

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.ArrayMethods
public class ArrayMethods
extends Object
Methods for working with arrays.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static Object[] EMPTY_OBJECT_ARRAY
    A zero-length Object array
    static String[] EMPTY_STRING_ARRAY
    A zero-length String array

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static <T> T[] append​(T[] array, T obj)
    Appends the specified object to the specified array.

    Returns a new array containing all elements of the specified arrays.

    Returns a new array containing all elements of the specified arrays.

    Returns the array index of the first occurrence of the specified reference within the specified array.

  • Method Details

    • append

      public static <T> T[] append​(T[] array, T obj)
      Appends the specified object to the specified array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to append the object to
      obj - The object to append
      Returns:
      A concatenation of array and obj

    • append

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T[] append​(T[] array, T obj0, T obj1, T... moreObjs)
      Appends the specified objects to the specified array.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to append the objects to
      obj0 - The 1st object to append
      obj1 - The 2nd object to append
      moreObjs - More objects to append
      Returns:
      A concatenation of array, obj1, obj2 and moreObjs

    • concat

      public static <T> T[] concat​(T[] arr0, T[] arr1)
      Returns a new array containing all elements of the specified arrays.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The element type of the arrays
      Parameters:
      arr0 - The 1st array to go into the new array
      arr1 - The 2nd array to go into the new array
      Returns:
      A new array containing all elements of the specified arrays

    • concat

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T[] concat​(T[] arr0, T[] arr1, T[] arr2, T[]... moreArrays)
      Returns a new array containing all elements of the specified arrays.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The element type of the arrays.
      Parameters:
      arr0 - The 1st array to go into the new array
      arr1 - The 2nd array to go into the new array
      arr2 - The 3rd array to go into the new array
      moreArrays - More arrays to concatenate
      Returns:
      A new array containing all elements of the specified arrays

    • inArray

      public static boolean inArray​(int value, int... array)
      Returns true if the specified array contains the specfied value, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to search for
      array - The array to search
      Returns:
      Whether or not the array contans the value

    • inArray

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> boolean inArray​(T value, T... array)
      Returns true if the specified array contains the specfied value, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to search for (may be null)
      array - The array to search
      Returns:
      Whether or not the array contans the value

    • isOneOf

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> boolean isOneOf​(T ref, T... array)
      Returns true if the specified array contains the specfied reference, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      ref - The reference to search for
      array - The array to search
      Returns:
      Whether or not the array contans the specfied referenc

    • fromTemplate

      public static <T> T[] fromTemplate​(T[] template)
      Returns a new, empty array with the same element type and length as the specified array's element type and length.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the requested array
      Parameters:
      template - An array with the same length and element type as the requested array

    • fromTemplate

      public static <T> T[] fromTemplate​(T[] template, int length)
      Returns a new, empty array with the same element type as the specified array's element type. The length of the returned array is specified through the length parameter.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements in the requested array
      Parameters:
      template - An array with the same element type as the requested array
      length - The desired length of the new array
      Returns:
      A new array with the same length and element type as the specified array

    • indexOf

      public static int indexOf​(int[] array, int value)
      Returns the array index of the first occurrence of the specified value within the specified array. Returns -1 if the array does not contain the value.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to search
      value - The value to search for
      Returns:
      The array index of the value

    • indexOf

      public static <T> int indexOf​(T[] array, T value)
      Returns the array index of the first occurrence of the specified value within the specified array. Returns -1 if the array does not contain the value. Searching for null is allowed. Comparisons are done using Objects.deepEquals(Object, Object).
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the elements within the array
      Parameters:
      array - The array to search
      value - The value to search for (may be null)
      Returns:
      The array index of the value

    • find

      public static int find​(Object[] array, Object reference)
      Returns the array index of the first occurrence of the specified reference within the specified array. Returns -1 if the array does not contain the reference. Searching for null is not allowed.
      Parameters:
      array - The array to search
      reference - The reference to search for (must not be null)
      Returns:
      The array index of the reference

    • indices

      public static <T> IntStream indices​(T[] array)
      Returns a Stream of the indices of the specified array.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The component type of the array
      Parameters:
      array - The array
      Returns:
      a Stream of its indices

    • pack

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T[] pack​(T... objs)
      Simply returns the specified array, but allows for leaner code. 

       String[] words0 = new String[] {"Hello", "world"};
 String[] words1 = pack("Hello", "world");
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the objects to pack
      Parameters:
      objs - The objects to pack
      Returns:
      The packed objects

    • prefix

      public static <T> T[] prefix​(T[] array, T obj)
      Prefixes the specified object to the specified array.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the array elements and the object to be prefixed
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be prefixed
      obj - The object to prefix
      Returns:
      A new array containing the specified object and the elements of the specified array

    • prefix

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> T[] prefix​(T[] array, T obj0, T obj1, T... moreObjs)
      Prefixes the specified object to the specified array.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the array elements and the object to be prefixed
      Parameters:
      array - The array to be prefixed
      obj0 - The 1st object to prefix
      obj1 - The 2nd object to prefix
      moreObjs - More objects to prefix
      Returns:
      A new array containing the specified objects and the elements of the specified array
